result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. Nejdlik

records.addlTxt: DA -via video  /Defendant telephonically

02:46 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court statement to remote appearances due to Supreme Court Order - COVID-19.
Also calling 16tr3668,15cm402,17cf68 - set for Review - 0 payments - will send notice of SDC to defendant.
Instructions for Remote Participation

02:45 PM Judge Partick O'Melia appearing by video. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court (appearing telephonically. Jillian Pfeifer appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 19CF333, 17CF68, 15CM402 & 16TR3668. In receipt of complaint - Defendant still needs to obtain counsel.  Court directs to contact PDs office. Bond continued. adj. 02:50 PM  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

02:06 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states does not qualify for PD - has employment. Has paperwork for Court appt counsel . Bond continued. adj. 02:08 PM  Review hearing scheduled for March 30, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
Court includes Br II cases for reviews hearings at same time so all cases are called together.
Review hearing on March 2, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

03:08 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM402, 17CF68, 19CF333 & 16TR3668. Defendant statement to counsel. Has called PDs office - does not want PD - trying to hire counsel out of Michigan. States he is going to pay fine - will be receiving taxes back. adj. 03:11 PM  Review hearing scheduled for March 2, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

02:02 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on employment. Court review of other cases--17CF68, 15CM402, 16TR3688 - RH scheduled for 2/3/20. Sowinski statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on January 13, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

03:24 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 19CF223 & 16TR3668. Defendant statement to payments, will make payment today and should be paid off within 45 days. adj. 03:24 PM  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

03:33 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM402 & 16TR3668. Defendnat statement to payments/employment. Bond continued. adj. 03:37 PM  Review hearing scheduled for November 11, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

03:33 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM402 & 16TR3668. Defendant statement to employment and payment. Bail continued. adj. 03:35 PM  Review hearing scheduled for September 23, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

03:40 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on payment.  Review hearing scheduled for July 8, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

01:48 PM Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in custody.  Mary Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cf68 (Revocation) and 15cm402, 16tr3668 (review hearings). All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Scholke statement to various adjournments. Sowinski/Scholke/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail - 1 year
Jail credit - 369 days (time served)
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment in 17cf68.
Court speaks to fines in 15cm402 and 16tr3668. Review hearing scheduled for February 25, 2019 at 3:00 p.m. If defendant is in treatment, must notify court to extend hearing date. 
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 2:06 p.m.

3:01 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court, in custody via video.  Calling 17cf68, 15cm402, 16tr3668. Defendant states he is thinking about revoking himself. Adj. 3:02 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 3, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

3:16 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court via video, in custody. Calling 17cf68, 16tr3668, 15cm402. Awaiting revocation - Court adjourns.  Review hearing scheduled for October 8, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appeared via video in custody. Defendant statement to time remaining in custody. Court schedules review hearing for July 30, 2018 at 3:00 p.m.

3:00 p,.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court, in custody via video.  Calling 15cm402, 17cf68, 16tr3668. Defendant speaks to revocation hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for June 4, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court, in custody via video.  Calling 17cf68,15cm402, 16,tr3668.  Defendant has been in custody and unable to make payments. Review hearing scheduled for April 9, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appeared in custody via video. Defendant statement to incarceration. Court schedules review hearing for March 5, 2018 at 3:00 p.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Defendant states he can make $50 monthly payments - his wife can pay. Court also authorizes community service at $10.00/hour. Calling 15cm402, 17cf68, 16tr3668.  Review hearing scheduled for January 8, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

3:26 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Calling 17cf68, 15cm402, 16tr3668. Defendant states that he spent time in prison and fines were supposed to be taken care of. Court explains not all time served applies towards fines. Defendant requests payment plan to start in 60 days at $50/month - just got hired at Walmart and waiting for background check to be done. Adj. 3:28 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant
Review hearing on September 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Per Jack at ONSO - in custody - Oneida County

Thomas stopped in and stated cannot pay anything until 12/1/16.  Will make payment of $150 that date.  Advised him bench warrant will be issued on 12/2/16 if no payment received--already 2 months behind.
defendant called and stated will be in the week of the 17th to put down $100.00

3:45 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court.  Defendant states that payment plan application confused him and has been paying $600/month child support. Defendant states he can make payment by Friday. No appearance necessary at next hearing if payment plan entered and first payment is made.  Review hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.

3:47 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes fine of $100 ($579 including costs). Defendant to submit DNA Sample.  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Appeal rights given. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:40 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:17 p.m. Defendant Thomas J. Nejdlik in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $500 sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 1:20 p.m.

Steven M. Michlig appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin. Defendant not in court.  Michlig states defendant in custody but too intoxicated to appear by video from jail.  Court finds defendant not medically cleared to appear. Adjourned.
